title: Will liquid staking cause Ethereum to succumb to the forces of centralization? - Blockworks
summary: Ethereum's transition to proof-of-stake (PoS) was intended to prevent centralization, but the popularity of liquid staking protocols like Lido has raised concerns about centralized control. Liquid staking allows holders to earn staking rewards without setting up their own hardware, but it has also led to a few centralized exchanges capturing a majority of the network's staking power. This could lead to a winner-take-all market structure, potentially undermining Ethereum's decentralized security model.

title: Ethereum Price Lacks Momentum Above $1,950 But Dips Could Be Limited - NewsBTC
summary: Ethereum price is struggling to break above $1,950, correcting gains from $1,975. The price is testing $1,930 support and could start another increase if it holds above this level. Resistance is at $1,950 and $2,000, while support is at $1,930, $1,910, and $1,900. Technical indicators, such as MACD and RSI, are losing momentum in the bullish zone. Any further losses could send the price towards $1,870 and potentially $1,820.

title: Will ERC 6551 transform Ethereum metaverses with NFT-owned wallets? - CryptoSlate
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

ERC 6551 is a new token standard for Ethereum that allows NFTs to own other tokens and assets, essentially giving them their own wallets. The proposal was created in response to the limitations of previous attempts to standardize NFTs owning assets, such as the need for custom logic in their smart contracts.

The standard consists of two main components: a permissionless registry for deploying token-bound accounts and a standard implementation interface. This allows NFTs to interact with the blockchain, record transaction history, and own on-chain assets.

The proposal has generated interest among crypto enthusiasts, with potential use cases in gaming, DAOs, infrastructure and tooling, and social networks. The authors of the proposal, Benny Giang and Jayden Windle, highlighted the potential for NFTs to become Network Playable Characters (NPCs) that can perform on-chain actions controlled by either a human or an AI model.

However, the proposal is still in the "Draft" status, and there are concerns about its security imp

title: The crypto scam that wasn’t: 2 teens reportedly stole $4.2 million in Bitcoin and Ethereum. Police say it never happened - Fortune
summary: Two teenagers in Canada reportedly scammed an American man out of $4.2 million in Bitcoin and Ethereum, but the entire story was a hoax, according to the Hamilton Police Service. The police said they did not investigate the case and the email did not originate from them. Coinbase, the exchange where the scam was allegedly carried out, has security resources dedicated to preventing phishing attacks and scams, and they work with international law enforcement to prosecute scammers. This is not the first time a crypto scam has been reported, with similar incidents happening in the past, including a 15-year-old boy stealing almost $24 million from a crypto millionaire and a teenager stealing almost $35 million through a SIM swap attack.

title: Tezos Generative Art Platform fxhash Adds Ethereum in Multichain Push - Decrypt
summary: Tezos-based generative art platform fxhash is expanding to the Ethereum blockchain, marking a significant step in its evolution. The platform, which has earned the reputation of being the "art blockchain," will now allow artists to create and sell generative artwork on both Tezos and Ethereum. This move is influenced by requests from partners for expansion beyond Tezos and aims to break down barriers between chains. The implementation of fxhash 2.0 will feature a multichain approach, showcasing artworks side by side regardless of the chain they were minted on. The platform boasts a diverse array of talented artists and has facilitated the movement of approximately $40 million to $45 million to artists. The team is currently working on the Ethereum integration, with a UI and UX overhaul and events planned for the launch.

title: Ethereum Price Set to Surpass $2,000: Staking on The Rise - Blockonomi
summary: Ethereum price may surpass $2,000 in the short term, driven by increased staking activity. Staking deposits have skyrocketed since the Shanghai upgrade, with Lido Finance dominating the staking pools. However, concerns about centralization have been raised due to Lido's significant footprint. Whale transactions have also increased, but the price of ETH has remained relatively stable. The upcoming Dencun upgrade is expected to bring improvements and optimizations to the network, which could fuel further growth.

title: Ethereum-Based Yield Powerhouse Pendle Finance Expands to BNB Chain - CoinDesk
summary: Pendle Finance, an Ethereum-based yield platform, has expanded to the BNB Chain. Despite the bear market, Pendle's locked value of tokens has grown nearly 300% since the start of the year, making it the tenth-largest TVL on Arbitrum and the biggest RocketPool ether holder.

title: Belgium's digital tsar on 'Europeum,' an Ethereum-like blockchain for Europe - DLNews
summary: Belgium is leading a European blockchain infrastructure project, called "Europeum," which aims to replicate the Ethereum network but with code that is open to view and managed, developed, and regulated by governments. Six countries have signed on to the project, including Belgium, Slovenia, Portugal, Croatia, Italy, and Poland. The project aims to simplify legal administration for companies, verify property titles and driving licenses, and verify national identities for easy verification on social media. The project will also help streamline the digitalization process for Belgium's economy and administration. Michel, Belgium's state secretary for digitalization, hopes that by the end of next year, every European Union member state will be working on the blockchain infrastructure project. He believes that blockchain can change the way European citizens and companies control their data and that it could help level up "the maturity, the comprehension about blockchain."

title: Bitcoin, Ethereum CME Contracts Hit $46.8B in Trading Volume Last Month - Decrypt
summary: Institutional investors turned to crypto products in June, with a focus on Bitcoin and Ethereum-backed instruments. CME Futures Contracts for both cryptocurrencies saw a significant increase in trading volume, with Bitcoin futures volumes rising 28.6% to $37.9 billion and Ethereum-based contracts notching a 10.8% rise. The USD value of the volume traded jumped 24.6% to $46.8 billion, the highest since May 2022. This increase in speculation and trading could have a positive impact on the CME Group's upcoming Ethereum-to-Bitcoin Ratio Futures product.

title: Account abstraction will drive a billion users from Asia to Web3: ConsenSys exec - Cointelegraph
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Account abstraction, a proposed Ethereum upgrade, could onboard a billion users from Asia to Web3, according to ConsenSys exec Laura Shi. Asia has seen strong expansion in DApps and Web3 adoption, driven by zero-knowledge Ethereum Virtual Machine (zkEVM) rollups and Optimistic Rollups. Account abstraction offers greater programmable functionality and bank-like features than regular crypto wallets, facilitating mass adoption in the region. Social and Web3 gaming use cases are also driving growth, particularly in South Korea and China. While the US industry crackdown may not be directly correlated with Ethereum ecosystem growth in Asia, the pivot to Asia has been a hot topic recently as US companies seek friendlier jurisdictions.

title: Tezos Generative Art Platform fxhash Adds Ethereum in Multichain Push - Yahoo Finance
summary: Tezos-based generative art platform fxhash is expanding to the Ethereum blockchain, marking a significant step in its evolution. The platform, which has earned the reputation of "the art blockchain," will now allow artists to create and sell generative artworks on both Tezos and Ethereum. This move is influenced by requests from partners for expansion beyond Tezos and aims to break down barriers between chains, elevating generative art above chain-specific limitations. fxhash boasts a diverse array of talented artists and has facilitated the movement of approximately $40-$45 million to artists, with the lion's share going to the creators. The team is currently working on the Ethereum integration, with a UI/UX overhaul and events planned for the launch. fxhash's goal is to shift the focus back to the art, rather than the chain it's on, and continue pushing the boundaries of what's possible for generative art.

title: Celsius moves altcoins to new wallets in preparation for Bitcoin and Ethereum conversion - CryptoSlate
summary: Celsius Network, a bankrupt crypto lender, has moved $70 million worth of altcoins to different wallets in preparation for selling them for Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH). The altcoins transferred include Chainlink, Polygon, Synthetix, Avalanche, and others. The firm also moved some ETH and WBTC tokens between related wallets. Celsius holds $614.28 million in crypto assets, with BTC and ETH accounting for over $400 million of its assets, and $100 million worth of its CEL native token.

title: Starknet's Quantum Leap hits testnet with TPS reaching 'triple figures' - Cointelegraph
summary: Starknet, an Ethereum layer-2 scaling protocol, has deployed its Quantum Leap upgrade on a testnet, which claims to process "hundreds of transactions per second" (TPS). This upgrade is expected to improve transaction speed by 50x or more, reaching "triple figures" during testing. The upgrade harmonizes the sequencer's code with the Cairo programming language and aims to reduce fees by 85% with the upcoming Volition upgrade. However, it's important to note that high TPS requires both technical capability and demand from users, and the upgrade does not solve the data availability problem faced by all zk-Rollups.

title: Taiwan Says Bitcoin, ETH Used in Bribery Cases - Cryptonews
summary: Taiwan has seen a rise in Bitcoin and Ethereum use in bribery cases, according to the justice ministry. The ministry warned that cash is no longer the only currency used in corruption cases, with BTC, ETH, and other coins emerging as tools of corruption. The government is concerned that these cryptocurrencies may be used as "election bribery tools" ahead of next year's general elections. In the past two decades, millions of dollars worth of rewards have been handed over to individuals who tipped police off about cases of suspect bribery. According to figures from the Supreme Prosecutor's Office, 1,335 cases of corruption were processed after last year's municipal elections, with over 700 people brought to trial on election-related corruption charges. Officials caught taking bribes include ex-executive body members, former central government officials, a mayor, a city council speaker, and a deputy speaker, as well as other high-ranking public office-holders.

title: Bitcoin, Ethereum and Other Crypto Assets Trade at Discount on Binance.US - Unchained - Unchained
summary: Major cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin and Ethereum traded at a discount on Binance.US last week, with some pairs seeing discounts of up to 5%. This comes after the exchange announced its decision to transition to a crypto-only exchange and removed most USD trading pairs. Kaiko analysts noted that liquidity has deteriorated significantly, resulting in average daily trading volumes plummeting from $450mn to $20mn. Meanwhile, Coinbase's market share in the U.S. increased, reaching its highest level since January.

title: Canadian Police Say Investigation Into Crypto Crime Involving Coinbase 'Did Not Occur' - Decrypt
summary: Canadian authorities have announced that an investigation into a crypto crime involving Coinbase did not occur, after a spoofed email from an alleged police representative was circulated to news outlets. The email claimed that two Canadian teenagers had defrauded a US man of $4.2 million in Bitcoin and Ethereum in a "spear phishing" attack. However, the Hamilton Police have confirmed that no investigation took place and that impersonating a police officer is a criminal offense. This incident highlights the ongoing issue of fakes and spoofs in the crypto space, with scammers using tactics such as Twitter bots, AI-generated CEOs, and fake celebrity endorsements to deceive users.

title: Goldman Sachs: Bitcoin, Ether Supply on Exchanges Fell in June – Bull Market Back? - Cryptonews
summary:
Here is a summary of the Goldman Sachs report in less than 256 tokens:

Bitcoin and Ether supply on exchanges fell significantly in June, with many crypto holders moving to self-custody due to regulatory crackdown fears and security concerns. Bitcoin miners also sold a record amount of inventory in June, leading to increased inflows to exchanges. Transaction fees returned to normal levels, leading to a rebound in monthly address activity for both Bitcoin and Ether. The report also noted a decline in average daily ether burned and average daily fees, and an increase in new on-chain activity. Based on these developments, the report suggests that the decline in supply on exchanges and increased on-chain activity may indicate a bullish market.

title: Binance halts deposit and withdrawal support for some Multichain-bridged tokens - Cointelegraph
summary: Binance has announced the temporary suspension of deposit and withdrawal support for several Multichain-bridged tokens due to ongoing challenges faced by the Multichain protocol. The affected tokens include Polkastarter, Alchemy Pay, SuperVerse, Harvest Finance, Beefy Finance, Alpaca Finance, Travala.com, and Spell Token. Binance recognized the inconvenience caused and highlighted that the halting of support is a risk management measure aimed at safeguarding users' funds. Trading of the tokens on Binance will not be affected, and users can still withdraw them through alternative networks. The decision comes amid turbulence around Multichain, including allegations of the protocol's co-founder and CEO going missing and speculation of a potential police investigation.

title: Dencun, the Ethereum Upgrade Poised to Revive Liquid Staking - The Coin Republic
summary: Ethereum is set to undergo an upgrade called Dencun, which aims to revive liquid staking. The upgrade, expected to arrive in Q4 2023, will introduce a new type of transaction called "blob-carrying transaction" that will reduce transaction costs for layer-2 users. Dencun will also shift the responsibility of storing the blockchain's state to a specialized "archival node," making it easier to run nodes and increasing network decentralization. Additionally, the upgrade will allow for the storage of more extensive sets of full nodes, reducing data storage requirements. The team lead of the Ethereum Foundation, Peter Szilagyi, suggested making EIP-4844 a priority in January 2023, and an external auditor has been hired to determine if currently deployed smart contracts can be broken down or changed. The upgrade is part of Vitalik Buterin's updated roadmap for the blockchain ecosystem, which includes upgrades such as Verge and Purge, which will increase scalability and reduce congestion.

title: Anatoly Yakovenko: Ethereum Can Be An L2 Solution For Solana - Blockzeit
summary: Anatoly Yakovenko, co-founder of Solana Labs, suggests that Ethereum could serve as a Layer-2 (L2) solution for Solana, providing additional security and interoperability. Key components for integration include submitting all Ethereum transactions to the Solana blockchain, implementing a Simplicity Payment Verification (SPV) root, and establishing a mechanism for fault detection and resolution. While this integration could enhance security and interoperability, it also raises concerns about limitations and potential hazards, such as disconnected assets in the event of an Ethereum fault. The incorporation of Ethereum as an L2 protocol within the DeFi ecosystem could impact central limit order books (CLOBs), automated market makers (AMMs), and borrowing and lending protocols for non-flash loans. Further evaluation and consideration are necessary to determine the potential consequences of this integration.
